newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sony to launch new digital cameras.
newsitem.headline: Sony to launch new digital cameras.

text.p: Sony Corp said on Friday it would launch two new digital cameras in Japan in October.
The Cyber-shot DSC-F1 will be priced at 88,000 yen and the DKC-D5PRO at 198,000 yen, Sony said.
A spokesman said the DSC-F1, which will also go on sale in the United States in October, is a full-feature, high-speed camera with infrared wireless capability.
The DKC-D5PRO, launched in the United States and Europe earlier this year under the name DKC-ID1, is equipped with a 12-times magnification zoom lens.
"Our prices may be a little higher than our competitors, but we are confident of our products' performance and high quality," the spokesman said.
The company expects an initial monthly output of 40,000 DSC-F1 cameras and 1,500 DKC-D5PRO cameras in Japan, he said.
Sony also said it will launch a digital color printer and a digital picture album in addition to the digital cameras.
